TITLE: Distribution Requirement
DEF: Courses taken for eductional variety within a program
TASK: The Distribution Requirement pattern involves the incorporation of courses from various disciplines within a program, promoting educational breadth. This stimulates learners' exploration of new knowledge fields and cultivates interdisciplinary comprehension. The main challenges include ensuring relevance and avoiding superficial engagement. Successful implementation is seen when flexibility is allowed in course selection, and when connections to the main study field are explicitly drawn.
